framework_context.description: Perception and Subjectivity is a specific domain within the Ontology branch, focusing on the nature of reality as perceived by individuals. It explores how subjective experiences shape our understanding of existence, integrating with Epistemology to examine how these perceptions are validated and understood.

key_concepts.name: Subjective Experience
key_concepts.explanation: The personal and individual aspects of perception, including emotions, beliefs, and personal biases that influence how we interpret reality.

key_concepts.name: Objective Reality
key_concepts.explanation: The external world independent of individual perceptions, which serves as a reference point for understanding subjective experiences.

key_concepts.name: Perceptual Filters
key_concepts.explanation: The cognitive and sensory mechanisms that shape how we perceive the world, including attention, memory, and past experiences.

major_principles.name: Subjective-Objective Duality
major_principles.description: The interplay between individual subjective experiences and objective reality, highlighting the complex relationship between internal perception and external existence.

major_principles.name: Contextual Dependence
major_principles.description: The understanding that perception is highly dependent on context, including cultural, social, and environmental factors that influence how we interpret reality.

major_principles.name: Dynamic Nature of Perception
major_principles.description: The recognition that perception is not static but dynamic, constantly evolving as new information is processed and integrated into existing knowledge structures.

relationships.connection: Perception and Subjectivity explores the fundamental nature of existence as perceived by individuals, directly contributing to our understanding of reality within the Ontology domain.
This domain intersects with Epistemology by examining how perceptions are validated and understood, influencing our foundational questions about knowledge acquisition and validation.

Perception and Subjectivity draws heavily from Cognitive Science to understand the mechanisms behind perception, including aspects like perception, attention, memory, language, problem-solving, and learning.

implications.description: The study of Perception and Subjectivity has significant implications for knowledge organization by highlighting the complex interplay between individual experiences and objective reality. It underscores the need for holistic approaches that integrate multiple perspectives to form a comprehensive understanding of the world.
